Description: Longitudinal project focused on the early detection, diagnosis, and monitoring of Alzheimer's disease. It collects extensive neuroimaging, biomarker, cognitive, and lifestyle data from participants over many years
Data: neuroimaging (MRI, PET), cognitive tests, clinical data, lifestyle information, and biomarkers (blood, genetics)

Description: Landmark longitudinal, multi-site study aimed at developing clinical, imaging, genetic, and biochemical biomarkers for the early detection and tracking of Alzheimer's disease. Its vast dataset includes MRI, PET, CSF/blood biomarkers, genetics, and cognitive tests from cognitively normal individuals, those with mild cognitive impairment, and those with dementia.
Data: multi-modal MRI, PET scans, CSF and blood biomarkers, genetics, and detailed cognitive/clinical assessments
neuroimaging (MRI, EEG), cognitive assessments, sociodemographic, and likely genetic data

Description: Comprehensive cross-sectional and longitudinal data from a large cohort (~700) of healthy adults across the lifespan (ages 18-88). It includes detailed MRI, MEG, cognitive, and questionnaire data aimed at understanding the neural basis of healthy cognitive aging.
Data: neuroimaging (structural MRI, fMRI, MEG), cognitive testing, and epidemiological data

Description: Large, longitudinal dataset focused on normal brain aging and Alzheimer's Disease, containing subjects aged 42-95. It provides extensive multi-modal neuroimaging (multiple MRI modalities, PET scans), along with clinical, cognitive, and biomarker data across multiple time points.
Data: multi-modal MRI (T1w, T2w, FLAIR, ASL, SWI, fMRI, DTI), PET (PiB, AV45, FDG, Tau), clinical assessments, cognitive scores, and some biomarker data
